const faqData={'getting-started':[{id:'gs1',question:'How do I add a new sensor node?',answer:'To add a new sensor node:

1. Navigate to Settings â†’ Nodes tab
2. Fill in Node ID (e.g., "Node4")
3. Enter cable length (hâ‚) in meters
4. Add location and region
5. Check "Activate immediately"
6. Click "Add Node"

The node will appear in your Dashboard once added.',tags:['node','sensor','add']},{id:'gs2',question:'What is cable length (hâ‚)?',answer:'Cable length (hâ‚) is the depth from surface to cable end.

It's critical for calculating water height:
â€¢ Water Height = hâ‚ - hâ‚‚
â€¢ hâ‚ = Cable length (fixed)
â€¢ hâ‚‚ = Sensor reading (varies)

Measure accurately during installation!',tags:['cable','h1','measurement']},{id:'gs3',question:'How do I activate or deactivate a node?',answer:'To toggle node activation:

1. Go to Settings â†’ Nodes tab
2. Find your node in the list
3. Click the eye icon (ðŸ‘ï¸) next to the node
4. Node toggles between Active âœ… and Inactive âšª

Only active nodes appear in monitoring dashboards.',tags:['activate','deactivate','toggle']},{id:'gs4',question:'What do I need to install a sensor?',answer:'Required equipment:

1. LoRa Sensor Module
2. Ultrasonic sensor cable
3. Power supply (solar/battery)
4. Mounting hardware
5. Waterproof enclosure

Optional:
â€¢ Lightning protection
â€¢ Extra batteries
â€¢ Signal booster

Contact support for installation guide!',tags:['installation','equipment','hardware']},{id:'gs5',question:'How far apart can sensor nodes be?',answer:'LoRa Range:

â€¢ Urban areas: 2-5 km
â€¢ Rural areas: 5-15 km
â€¢ Line of sight: Up to 15 km

Factors affecting range:
â€¢ Buildings and obstacles
â€¢ Terrain elevation
â€¢ Weather conditions
â€¢ Antenna placement

Use signal strength indicator to optimize placement.',tags:['range','distance','lora']},{id:'gs6',question:'What is the difference between Admin, Operator, and Viewer roles?',answer:'User Roles:

**Admin:**
â€¢ Full system access
â€¢ Manage users
â€¢ Configure all settings
â€¢ Delete nodes

**Operator:**
â€¢ Monitor sensors
â€¢ View analytics
â€¢ Configure nodes
â€¢ Cannot delete or manage users

**Viewer:**
â€¢ Read-only access
â€¢ View dashboards
â€¢ View reports
â€¢ Cannot modify anything',tags:['roles','permissions','users']}],'monitoring':[{id:'mon1',question:'How often does data update?',answer:'Sensor data updates in real-time via Firebase.

â€¢ Data flows continuously
â€¢ Dashboard auto-refreshes every 30s
â€¢ Change rate in Settings â†’ System
â€¢ Manual refresh: Click navbar button',tags:['update','refresh','real-time']},{id:'mon2',question:'What do node statuses mean?',answer:'Node status colors:

ðŸŸ¢ Active: Water > 10m
ðŸŸ¡ Warning: Water 5-10m
ðŸŸ  Low: Water 0-5m
ðŸ”´ Critical: No water
âšª Inactive: Not activated',tags:['status','color','indicator']},{id:'mon3',question:'How do I view historical data?',answer:'Access historical data:

1. Go to Analytics page
2. Select node from dropdown
3. Choose time range (24h/7d/30d/custom)
4. View charts or tables
5. Export as CSV/JSON

Data retained for 30 days (default).',tags:['history','analytics','data']},{id:'mon4',question:'Can I monitor multiple wells at once?',answer:'Yes! Multiple monitoring options:

â€¢ Dashboard: All nodes in grid
â€¢ Monitor: Switch between nodes
â€¢ Analytics: Compare up to 3 nodes
â€¢ Health: System-wide overview

All update in real-time!',tags:['multiple','wells','comparison']},{id:'mon5',question:'What is the minimum water level I can measure?',answer:'Measurement capabilities:

â€¢ Minimum: 0.5 meters
â€¢ Maximum: Depends on cable length
â€¢ Accuracy: Â±2cm
â€¢ Resolution: 1cm

For shallow wells under 0.5m, use shorter cables or different sensor type.',tags:['measurement','minimum','accuracy']},{id:'mon6',question:'How accurate are the water level readings?',answer:'Sensor Accuracy:

â€¢ Standard accuracy: Â±2cm
â€¢ Temperature drift: Â±0.5%
â€¢ Response time: <1 second
â€¢ Calibration: Every 6 months

Factors affecting accuracy:
â€¢ Sensor alignment
â€¢ Temperature changes
â€¢ Water turbulence
â€¢ Cable tension

Regular calibration maintains accuracy.',tags:['accuracy','precision','calibration']},{id:'mon7',question:'Can I set custom water level thresholds?',answer:'Customize alert thresholds:

1. Settings â†’ System tab
2. Find "Alert Thresholds"
3. Set custom levels:
   â€¢ Critical: < 2m (red)
   â€¢ Low: 2-5m (orange)
   â€¢ Warning: 5-10m (yellow)
   â€¢ Normal: > 10m (green)
4. Save changes

Alerts trigger when thresholds crossed.',tags:['threshold','custom','alerts']}],'notifications':[{id:'not1',question:'How do I enable notifications?',answer:'To enable push notifications:

1. Click bell icon (ðŸ””) in navbar
2. Click "Enable Notifications"
3. Allow browser permissions
4. Receive confirmation

Get alerts when sensors go offline!',tags:['notifications','alerts','enable']},{id:'not2',question:'What types of notifications will I receive?',answer:'Alert Types:

**Critical:**
â€¢ Sensor offline (5+ min)
â€¢ Water level critical (< 2m)
â€¢ System errors

**Warning:**
â€¢ Low water level (2-5m)
â€¢ Battery low (<20%)
â€¢ Connection unstable

**Info:**
â€¢ Sensor back online
â€¢ Daily reports
â€¢ Maintenance reminders',tags:['types','alerts','categories']},{id:'not3',question:'Can I customize notification settings?',answer:'Customize notifications:

1. Settings â†’ System
2. Configure:
   â€¢ Check interval (10-300s)
   â€¢ Timeout threshold (60-1800s)
   â€¢ Alert types (critical/warning/info)
   â€¢ Quiet hours (optional)
   â€¢ Notification channels (email/SMS/push)

3. Profile â†’ Preferences
   â€¢ Toggle notification types
   â€¢ Set preferred channels',tags:['customize','settings','preferences']},{id:'not4',question:'Why am I not receiving notifications?',answer:'Troubleshooting steps:

1. Check browser permissions
2. Verify alerts enabled (Settings â†’ System)
3. Check notification panel (ðŸ””)
4. Test notification (click "Test" button)
5. Clear browser cache
6. Try different browser

Still issues? Check:
â€¢ Do Not Disturb mode (OS)
â€¢ Browser notification settings
â€¢ Firewall blocking notifications',tags:['troubleshooting','not working','fix']},{id:'not5',question:'Can I receive SMS or email alerts?',answer:'Multi-channel alerts:

**SMS Alerts:**
â€¢ Available for premium accounts

â€¢ Enter phone number
â€¢ Verify via code

**Email Alerts:**
â€¢ Free for all accounts
â€¢ Automatic email verification
â€¢ Daily/weekly digest options
â€¢ Instant critical alerts

Contact support to enable premium features.',tags:['sms','email','channels']}],'settings':[{id:'set1',question:'How do I backup configuration?',answer:'To backup:

1. Settings â†’ Backup tab
2. Click "Export"
3. JSON file downloads
4. Store safely

Includes all nodes and settings.',tags:['backup','export']},{id:'set2',question:'Can I import settings from another system?',answer:'Import configuration:

1. Settings â†’ Backup tab
2. Click "Import"
3. Select JSON file
4. Review changes
5. Confirm import

âš ï¸ Warning: Overwrites current settings!
Backup first!',tags:['import','restore','transfer']},{id:'set3',question:'How do I change my password?',answer:'Change password:

1. Profile â†’ Security tab
2. Enter current password
3. Enter new password (min 6 chars)
4. Confirm new password
5. Click "Change Password"

You'll be logged out. Sign in with new password.',tags:['password','security']},{id:'set4',question:'Can I change the dashboard refresh rate?',answer:'Adjust refresh rate:

1. Settings â†’ System tab
2. Find "Auto Refresh Interval"
3. Set 10-300 seconds
4. Toggle "Auto Refresh" on/off
5. Save settings

Lower = more frequent but higher data usage.',tags:['refresh','rate','dashboard']},{id:'set5',question:'How do I change the theme or language?',answer:'Customize appearance:

**Theme:**
1. Settings â†’ Preferences

   â€¢ Light (default)
   â€¢ Dark

   â€¢ English
   â€¢ Swahili (Kiswahili)
   â€¢ More coming soon!

Changes apply immediately.',tags:['theme','language','appearance']},{id:'set6',question:'What data retention options are available?',answer:'Data retention settings:

1. Settings â†’ System
2. Set retention period:
   â€¢ 7 days (minimal)
   â€¢ 30 days (default)
   â€¢ 90 days (recommended)
   â€¢ 365 days (maximum)

**Note:**
â€¢ Longer retention = more storage
â€¢ Analytics limited by retention
â€¢ Export data before it expires
â€¢ Premium: Unlimited retention',tags:['retention','storage','data']}],'troubleshooting':[{id:'trb1',question:'Node shows offline?',answer:'Check:

1. Sensor powered on?
2. Cables connected?
3. Within 5m of cable end?
4. Check Health â†’ System Logs

Still offline? Contact support.',tags:['offline','fix']},{id:'trb2',question:'Water shows 0m?',answer:'If hâ‚‚ â‰¥ hâ‚, water = 0m.

Solution:
1. Settings â†’ Nodes
2. Check hâ‚ value
3. Update if incorrect
4. Save changes

Formula: H = hâ‚ - hâ‚‚',tags:['zero','water','height']},{id:'trb3',question:'Dashboard not updating?',answer:'Fix dashboard issues:

1. Check auto-refresh (Settings â†’ System)
2. Hard refresh: Ctrl+Shift+R
3. Clear browser cache
4. Check internet connection
5. Verify Firebase status (Health page)
6. Try different browser

If Health shows "Connected", data is flowing.',tags:['dashboard','update','refresh']},{id:'trb4',question:'Sensor readings are erratic?',answer:'Stabilize readings:

**Common causes:**
â€¢ Loose cable connections
â€¢ Water turbulence
â€¢ Sensor misalignment
â€¢ Electrical interference
â€¢ Temperature changes

**Solutions:**
1. Secure all connections
2. Wait for water to settle
3. Check sensor position
4. Move away from electrical lines
5. Recalibrate sensor

Contact support if persists.',tags:['erratic','unstable','fluctuating']},{id:'trb5',question:'How do I reset a sensor node?',answer:'Reset procedure:

**Soft Reset:**
1. Settings â†’ Nodes
2. Click edit on node
3. Click "Reset Configuration"
4. Confirm reset

**Hard Reset:**
1. Power off sensor
2. Wait 30 seconds
3. Power on sensor
4. Reconfigure in dashboard

**Factory Reset:**
â€¢ Contact support
â€¢ Requires physical access
â€¢ Clears all settings',tags:['reset','restart','reboot']},{id:'trb6',question:'Battery draining too quickly?',answer:'Extend battery life:

**Check settings:**
â€¢ Reduce check interval
â€¢ Lower transmission power
â€¢ Disable unnecessary features

**Hardware:**
â€¢ Clean solar panel
â€¢ Check battery health
â€¢ Verify charging circuit
â€¢ Upgrade to larger battery

**Expected life:**
â€¢ Solar + battery: Indefinite
â€¢ Battery only: 6-12 months
â€¢ Depends on usage

Monitor in Health â†’ Node Status.',tags:['battery','power','drain']}],'technical':[{id:'tech1',question:'Water height formula?',answer:'H = hâ‚ - hâ‚‚

Where:
â€¢ H = Water height
â€¢ hâ‚ = Cable length (fixed)
â€¢ hâ‚‚ = Sensor reading (varies)

Example: 50m - 45m = 5m water',tags:['formula','calculation']},{id:'tech2',question:'How does LoRa communication work?',answer:'LoRa Technology:

**Sensor â†’ Gateway:**
â€¢ Long Range (2-15km)
â€¢ Low Power (<50mA)
â€¢ 868/915 MHz frequency
â€¢ Encrypted transmission

**Gateway â†’ Cloud:**
â€¢ Internet connection
â€¢ Uploads to Firebase
â€¢ Real-time sync

**Cloud â†’ Dashboard:**
â€¢ WebSocket connection
â€¢ Instant updates
â€¢ Data caching

**Benefits:**
â€¢ No cellular data needed
â€¢ Works in remote areas
â€¢ Very low power consumption',tags:['lora','communication','wireless']},{id:'tech3',question:'What data is stored in Firebase?',answer:'Database structure:

**Real-time Data:**
â€¢ Sensor readings (hâ‚‚)
â€¢ Timestamps
â€¢ Connection status
â€¢ Battery levels

**Configuration:**
â€¢ Node settings (hâ‚, location)
â€¢ System preferences
â€¢ User profiles
â€¢ Alert thresholds

**Historical:**
â€¢ Activity logs
â€¢ System events
â€¢ Error reports

**Security:**
â€¢ Encrypted at rest
â€¢ Encrypted in transit
â€¢ Role-based access',tags:['firebase','database','storage']},{id:'tech4',question:'Can I integrate with other systems?',answer:'Integration options:

**REST API:**
â€¢ GET /api/nodes - List nodes
â€¢ GET /api/data/{nodeId} - Get readings
â€¢ POST /api/alerts - Create alert
â€¢ Authentication required

**Webhooks:**
â€¢ Real-time data push
â€¢ Configure in Settings
â€¢ JSON payload
â€¢ Retry on failure

**Exports:**
â€¢ CSV/JSON download
â€¢ Scheduled exports
â€¢ Email delivery
â€¢ FTP/SFTP upload

API docs: docs.waleki.com/api',tags:['api','integration','webhook']},{id:'tech5',question:'What is the system architecture?',answer:'Waleki Architecture:

**1. Sensor Layer:**
â€¢ Ultrasonic sensors
â€¢ LoRa transmitters
â€¢ Solar/battery power

**2. Network Layer:**
â€¢ LoRa gateways
â€¢ Internet connection
â€¢ Edge processing

**3. Cloud Layer:**
â€¢ Firebase Realtime DB
â€¢ Authentication
â€¢ File storage

**4. Application Layer:**
â€¢ React web app
â€¢ Real-time updates
â€¢ Analytics engine

**5. User Layer:**
â€¢ Web browsers
â€¢ Mobile devices
â€¢ Admin panels',tags:['architecture','system','design']},{id:'tech6',question:'How is data secured?',answer:'Security measures:

**Data Encryption:**
â€¢ TLS 1.3 in transit
â€¢ AES-256 at rest
â€¢ End-to-end encryption

**Authentication:**
â€¢ Firebase Auth
â€¢ Email verification
â€¢ 2FA support
â€¢ Session management

**Authorization:**
â€¢ Role-based access
â€¢ Granular permissions
â€¢ Audit logging

**Network:**
â€¢ Firewall protection
â€¢ DDoS mitigation
â€¢ Rate limiting
â€¢ IP filtering

**Compliance:**
â€¢ GDPR ready
â€¢ Data privacy
â€¢ Regular audits',tags:['security','encryption','privacy']}]};const searchFAQs=()=>{if(!searchQuery.trim())return[];const query=searchQuery.toLowerCase();const results=[];Object.entries(faqData).forEach(_ref2=>{let[category,faqs]=_ref2;faqs.forEach(faq=>{if(faq.question.toLowerCase().includes(query)||faq.answer.toLowerCase().includes(query)||faq.tags.some(tag=>tag.includes(query))){results.push(_objectSpread(_objectSpread({},faq),{},{category}));}});});return results;};const displayedFAQs=searchQuery.trim()?searchFAQs():faqData[activeTab]||[];const handleFeedback=(faqId,helpful)=>{setFeedbackGiven(_objectSpread(_objectSpread({},feedbackGiven),{},{[faqId]:helpful}));showToast(helpful?'Thanks for feedback!':'We'll improve this','success');};const copyToClipboard=text=>{navigator.clipboard.writeText(text);showToast('Copied to clipboard!','success');};return/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"help-page",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("style",{jsx:true,children:"
        @keyframes slideIn {
          from { transform: translateX(400px); opacity: 0; }
          to { transform: translateX(0); opacity: 1; }
        }
        .help-page {
          min-height: 100vh;
          background: linear-gradient(135deg, #f8fafc 0%, #e2e8f0 50%, #f1f5f9 100%);
          padding: 24px;
          font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', 'Roboto', sans-serif;
        }
        .help-header {
          background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0f172a 0%, #1e3a5f 50%, #0c4a6e 100%);
          border-radius: 24px;
          padding: 48px 40px;
          margin-bottom: 24px;
          color: white;
          position: relative;
          overflow: hidden;
          box-shadow: 0 20px 60px rgba(15, 23, 42, 0.3);
        }
        .help-header::before {
          content: '';
          position: absolute;
          top: -50%;
          right: -20%;
          width: 500px;
          height: 500px;
          background: radial-gradient(circle, rgba(56, 189, 248, 0.2) 0%, transparent 60%);
          border-radius: 50%;
        }
        .header-content {
          position: relative;
          z-index: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          gap: 32px;
        }
        .header-icon-large {
          width: 80px;
          height: 80px;
          background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
          border-radius: 20px;
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          justify-content: center;
          backdrop-filter: blur(10px);
        }
        .header-info { flex: 1; }
        .header-title {
          font-size: 36px;
          font-weight: 700;
          margin-bottom: 12px;
          letter-spacing: -1px;
        }
        .header-subtitle {
          font-size: 16px;
          opacity: 0.95;
          line-height: 1.6;
        }
        .search-section {
          background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.95);
          backdrop-filter: blur(10px);
          border-radius: 20px;
          padding: 24px;
          margin-bottom: 24px;
          border: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8);
          box-shadow: 0 4px 16px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.04);
        }
        .search-wrapper { position: relative; }
        .search-icon {
          position: absolute;
          left: 18px;
          top: 50%;
          transform: translateY(-50%);
          color: #999;
        }
        .search-input {
          width: 100%;
          padding: 16px 20px 16px 52px;
          border: 2px solid #E8E8E8;
          border-radius: 12px;
          font-size: 15px;
          outline: none;
          transition: all 0.2s ease;
        }
        .search-input:focus {
          border-color: #0369a1;
          box-shadow: 0 0 0 3px rgba(3, 105, 161, 0.1);
        }
        .help-content {
          display: grid;
          grid-template-columns: 280px 1fr;
          gap: 24px;
        }
        .sidebar { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 16px; }
        .sidebar-card {
          background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.95);
          backdrop-filter: blur(10px);
          border-radius: 20px;
          padding: 16px;
          border: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8);
          box-shadow: 0 4px 16px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.04);
        }
        .nav-item {
          width: 100%;
          padding: 14px 16px;
          background: transparent;
          border: none;
          border-radius: 12px;
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          gap: 12px;
          font-size: 14px;
          font-weight: 600;
          color: #666;
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: all 0.2s ease;
          margin-bottom: 6px;
        }
        .nav-item:hover { background: #F5F5F5; color: #000; }
        .nav-item.active {
          background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0369a1, #0284c7);
          color: white;
          box-shadow: 0 4px 12px rgba(3, 105, 161, 0.2);
        }
        .quick-link-item {
          padding: 12px;
          background: #FAFAFA;
          border-radius: 10px;
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          gap: 12px;
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: all 0.2s ease;
          border: 1px solid #F0F0F0;
          margin-bottom: 8px;
        }
        .quick-link-item:hover {
          background: white;
          border-color: #000;
        }
        .quick-link-icon {
          width: 36px;
          height: 36px;
          border-radius: 10px;
          background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0369a1, #0284c7);
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          justify-content: center;
          color: white;
        }
        .quick-link-text {
          font-size: 13px;
          font-weight: 600;
          color: #000;
        }
        .main-content {
          background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.95);
          backdrop-filter: blur(10px);
          border-radius: 20px;
          padding: 32px;
          border: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8);
          box-shadow: 0 4px 24px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.04);
        }
        .content-header {
          margin-bottom: 32px;
          padding-bottom: 20px;
          border-bottom: 1px solid #F0F0F0;
        }
        .content-title {
          font-size: 24px;
          font-weight: 700;
          color: #000;
          margin-bottom: 8px;
        }
        .content-subtitle {
          font-size: 15px;
          color: #666;
        }
        .faq-list { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 16px; }
        .faq-item {
          background: #FAFAFA;
          border-radius: 12px;
          border: 1px solid #F0F0F0;
          overflow: hidden;
        }
        .faq-question-btn {
          width: 100%;
          padding: 20px;
          background: transparent;
          border: none;
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          justify-content: space-between;
          cursor: pointer;
        }
        .faq-question-text {
          font-size: 15px;
          font-weight: 700;
          color: #000;
        }
        .faq-answer {
          padding: 0 20px 20px;
          font-size: 14px;
          color: #666;
          line-height: 1.8;
          white-space: pre-line;
        }
        .faq-actions {
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          gap: 12px;
          margin-top: 16px;
          padding-top: 16px;
          border-top: 1px solid #F0F0F0;
        }
        .feedback-text {
          font-size: 13px;
          color: #999;
          font-weight: 600;
        }
        .action-btn {
          width: 32px;
          height: 32px;
          border-radius: 8px;
          background: white;
          border: 1px solid #E8E8E8;
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          justify-content: center;
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: all 0.2s ease;
          color: #666;
        }
        .action-btn:hover {
          border-color: #000;
          color: #000;
        }
        .action-btn.active-positive {
          background: #DCFCE7;
          border-color: #16A34A;
          color: #16A34A;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1024px) {
          .help-content { grid-template-columns: 1fr; }
          .header-content { flex-direction: column; }
        }
      "}),toast&&/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Toast,{message:toast.message,type:toast.type,onClose:()=>setToast(null)}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"help-header",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"header-content",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"header-icon-large",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(HelpCircle,{size:40})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"header-info",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("h1",{className:"header-title",children:"Help & Support"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("p",{className:"header-subtitle",children:"Find answers and get expert support"})]})]})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"search-section",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"search-wrapper",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Search,{size:20,className:"search-icon"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("input",{type:"text",className:"search-input",placeholder:"Search help articles...",value:searchQuery,onChange:e=>setSearchQuery(e.target.value)})]})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"help-content",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"sidebar",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"sidebar-card",children:Object.keys(faqData).map(tab=>/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("button",{className:"nav-item ".concat(activeTab===tab?'active':''),onClick:()=>{setActiveTab(tab);setSearchQuery('');},children:[tab==='getting-started'&&/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Zap,{size:18}),tab==='monitoring'&&/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(BarChart3,{size:18}),tab==='notifications'&&/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Bell,{size:18}),tab==='settings'&&/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Settings,{size:18}),tab==='troubleshooting'&&/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(AlertTriangle,{size:18}),tab==='technical'&&/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Database,{size:18}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("span",{children:tab.split('-').map(w=>w[0].toUpperCase()+w.slice(1)).join(' ')})]},tab))}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"sidebar-card",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"quick-link-item",onClick:()=>navigate('/settings'),children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"quick-link-icon",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Settings,{size:16})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("span",{className:"quick-link-text",children:"Settings"})]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"quick-link-item",onClick:()=>navigate('/profile'),children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"quick-link-icon",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Users,{size:16})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("span",{className:"quick-link-text",children:"Profile"})]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"quick-link-item",onClick:()=>window.open('mailto:support@waleki.com'),children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"quick-link-icon",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Mail,{size:16})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("span",{className:"quick-link-text",children:"Email"})]})]})]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"main-content",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"content-header",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("h2",{className:"content-title",children:searchQuery.trim()?"Search: "".concat(searchQuery,"""):activeTab.split('-').map(w=>w[0].toUpperCase()+w.slice(1)).join(' ')}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("p",{className:"content-subtitle",children:[displayedFAQs.length," article",displayedFAQs.length!==1?'s':''," found"]})]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"faq-list",children:displayedFAQs.map(faq=>/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"faq-item",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("button",{className:"faq-question-btn",onClick:()=>setExpandedFAQ(expandedFAQ===faq.id?null:faq.id),children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"faq-question-text",children:faq.question}),expandedFAQ===faq.id?/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(ChevronDown,{size:20}):/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(ChevronRight,{size:20})]}),expandedFAQ===faq.id&&/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"faq-answer",children:[faq.answer,/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"faq-actions",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("span",{className:"feedback-text",children:"Helpful?"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("button",{className:"action-btn ".concat(feedbackGiven[faq.id]===true?'active-positive':''),onClick:()=>handleFeedback(faq.id,true),children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(ThumbsUp,{size:14})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("button",{className:"action-btn ".concat(feedbackGiven[faq.id]===false?'active-negative':''),onClick:()=>handleFeedback(faq.id,false),children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(ThumbsDown,{size:14})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("button",{className:"action-btn",onClick:()=>copyToClipboard(faq.answer),style:{marginLeft:'auto'},children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(Copy,{size:14})})]})]})]},faq.id))})]})]})]});};export default HelpPage;

sourcesContent:
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom'; import { HelpCircle, Search, ChevronDown, ChevronRight, Copy, CheckCircle, AlertTriangle, Zap, Settings, BarChart3, Bell, Database, ThumbsUp, ThumbsDown, Mail, Phone, Users } from 'lucide-react'; // Toast Component const Toast = ({ message, type, onClose }) => { useEffect(() => { const timer = setTimeout(onClose, 3000); return () => clearTimeout(timer); }, [onClose]); const bgColor = type === 'success' ? '#16A34A' : type === 'error' ? '#DC2626' : '#000'; const Icon = type === 'success' ? CheckCircle : AlertTriangle; return (
{message}
); }; const HelpPage = () => { const navigate = useNavigate(); const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('getting-started'); const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState(''); const [expandedFAQ, setExpandedFAQ] = useState(null); const [toast, setToast] = useState(null); const [feedbackGiven, setFeedbackGiven] = useState({}); const showToast = (message, type = 'success') => { setToast({ message, type }); }; // FAQ Data const faqData = { 'getting-started': [ { id: 'gs1', question: 'How do I add a new sensor node?', answer: 'To add a new sensor node: 1. Navigate to Settings â†’ Nodes tab 2. Fill in Node ID (e.g., "Node4") 3. Enter cable length (hâ‚) in meters 4. Add location and region 5. Check "Activate immediately" 6. Click "Add Node" The node will appear in your Dashboard once added.', tags: ['node', 'sensor', 'add'] }, { id: 'gs2', question: 'What is cable length (hâ‚)?', answer: 'Cable length (hâ‚) is the depth from surface to cable end. It's critical for calculating water height: â€¢ Water Height = hâ‚ - hâ‚‚ â€¢ hâ‚ = Cable length (fixed) â€¢ hâ‚‚ = Sensor reading (varies) Measure accurately during installation!', tags: ['cable', 'h1', 'measurement'] }, { id: 'gs3', question: 'How do I activate or deactivate a node?', answer: 'To toggle node activation: 1. Go to Settings â†’ Nodes tab 2. Find your node in the list 3. Click the eye icon (ðŸ‘ï¸) next to the node 4. Node toggles between Active âœ… and Inactive âšª Only active nodes appear in monitoring dashboards.', tags: ['activate', 'deactivate', 'toggle'] }, { id: 'gs4', question: 'What do I need to install a sensor?', answer: 'Required equipment: 1. LoRa Sensor Module 2. Ultrasonic sensor cable 3. Power supply (solar/battery) 4. Mounting hardware 5. Waterproof enclosure Optional: â€¢ Lightning protection â€¢ Extra batteries â€¢ Signal booster Contact support for installation guide!', tags: ['installation', 'equipment', 'hardware'] }, { id: 'gs5', question: 'How far apart can sensor nodes be?', answer: 'LoRa Range: â€¢ Urban areas: 2-5 km â€¢ Rural areas: 5-15 km â€¢ Line of sight: Up to 15 km Factors affecting range: â€¢ Buildings and obstacles â€¢ Terrain elevation â€¢ Weather conditions â€¢ Antenna placement Use signal strength indicator to optimize placement.', tags: ['range', 'distance', 'lora'] }, { id: 'gs6', question: 'What is the difference between Admin, Operator, and Viewer roles?', answer: 'User Roles: **Admin:** â€¢ Full system access â€¢ Manage users â€¢ Configure all settings â€¢ Delete nodes **Operator:** â€¢ Monitor sensors â€¢ View analytics â€¢ Configure nodes â€¢ Cannot delete or manage users **Viewer:** â€¢ Read-only access â€¢ View dashboards â€¢ View reports â€¢ Cannot modify anything', tags: ['roles', 'permissions', 'users'] } ], 'monitoring': [ { id: 'mon1', question: 'How often does data update?', answer: 'Sensor data updates in real-time via Firebase. â€¢ Data flows continuously â€¢ Dashboard auto-refreshes every 30s â€¢ Change rate in Settings â†’ System â€¢ Manual refresh: Click navbar button', tags: ['update', 'refresh', 'real-time'] }, { id: 'mon2', question: 'What do node statuses mean?', answer: 'Node status colors: ðŸŸ¢ Active: Water > 10m ðŸŸ¡ Warning: Water 5-10m ðŸŸ  Low: Water 0-5m ðŸ”´ Critical: No water âšª Inactive: Not activated', tags: ['status', 'color', 'indicator'] }, { id: 'mon3', question: 'How do I view historical data?', answer: 'Access historical data: 1. Go to Analytics page 2. Select node from dropdown 3. Choose time range (24h/7d/30d/custom) 4. View charts or tables 5. Export as CSV/JSON Data retained for 30 days (default).', tags: ['history', 'analytics', 'data'] }, { id: 'mon4', question: 'Can I monitor multiple wells at once?', answer: 'Yes! Multiple monitoring options: â€¢ Dashboard: All nodes in grid â€¢ Monitor: Switch between nodes â€¢ Analytics: Compare up to 3 nodes â€¢ Health: System-wide overview All update in real-time!', tags: ['multiple', 'wells', 'comparison'] }, { id: 'mon5', question: 'What is the minimum water level I can measure?', answer: 'Measurement capabilities: â€¢ Minimum: 0.5 meters â€¢ Maximum: Depends on cable length â€¢ Accuracy: Â±2cm â€¢ Resolution: 1cm For shallow wells under 0.5m, use shorter cables or different sensor type.', tags: ['measurement', 'minimum', 'accuracy'] }, { id: 'mon6', question: 'How accurate are the water level readings?', answer: 'Sensor Accuracy: â€¢ Standard accuracy: Â±2cm â€¢ Temperature drift: Â±0.5% â€¢ Response time: <1 second â€¢ Calibration: Every 6 months Factors affecting accuracy: â€¢ Sensor alignment â€¢ Temperature changes â€¢ Water turbulence â€¢ Cable tension Regular calibration maintains accuracy.', tags: ['accuracy', 'precision', 'calibration'] }, { id: 'mon7', question: 'Can I set custom water level thresholds?', answer: 'Customize alert thresholds: 1. Settings â†’ System tab 2. Find "Alert Thresholds" 3. Set custom levels: â€¢ Critical: < 2m (red) â€¢ Low: 2-5m (orange) â€¢ Warning: 5-10m (yellow) â€¢ Normal: > 10m (green) 4. Save changes Alerts trigger when thresholds crossed.', tags: ['threshold', 'custom', 'alerts'] } ], 'notifications': [ { id: 'not1', question: 'How do I enable notifications?', answer: 'To enable push notifications: 1. Click bell icon (ðŸ””) in navbar 2. Click "Enable Notifications" 3. Allow browser permissions 4. Receive confirmation Get alerts when sensors go offline!', tags: ['notifications', 'alerts', 'enable'] }, { id: 'not2', question: 'What types of notifications will I receive?', answer: 'Alert Types: **Critical:** â€¢ Sensor offline (5+ min) â€¢ Water level critical (< 2m) â€¢ System errors **Warning:** â€¢ Low water level (2-5m) â€¢ Battery low (<20%) â€¢ Connection unstable **Info:** â€¢ Sensor back online â€¢ Daily reports â€¢ Maintenance reminders', tags: ['types', 'alerts', 'categories'] }, { id: 'not3', question: 'Can I customize notification settings?', answer: 'Customize notifications: 1. Settings â†’ System 2. Configure: â€¢ Check interval (10-300s) â€¢ Timeout threshold (60-1800s) â€¢ Alert types (critical/warning/info) â€¢ Quiet hours (optional) â€¢ Notification channels (email/SMS/push) 3. Profile â†’ Preferences â€¢ Toggle notification types â€¢ Set preferred channels', tags: ['customize', 'settings', 'preferences'] }, { id: 'not4', question: 'Why am I not receiving notifications?', answer: 'Troubleshooting steps: 1. Check browser permissions 2. Verify alerts enabled (Settings â†’ System) 3. Check notification panel (ðŸ””) 4. Test notification (click "Test" button) 5. Clear browser cache 6. Try different browser Still issues? Check: â€¢ Do Not Disturb mode (OS) â€¢ Browser notification settings â€¢ Firewall blocking notifications', tags: ['troubleshooting', 'not working', 'fix'] }, { id: 'not5', question: 'Can I receive SMS or email alerts?', answer: 'Multi-channel alerts: **SMS Alerts:** â€¢ Available for premium accounts â€¢ Configure in Settings â†’ Notifications â€¢ Enter phone number â€¢ Verify via code â€¢ Set SMS preferences **Email Alerts:** â€¢ Free for all accounts â€¢ Automatic email verification â€¢ Daily/weekly digest options â€¢ Instant critical alerts Contact support to enable premium features.', tags: ['sms', 'email', 'channels'] } ], 'settings': [ { id: 'set1', question: 'How do I backup configuration?', answer: 'To backup: 1. Settings â†’ Backup tab 2. Click "Export" 3. JSON file downloads 4. Store safely Includes all nodes and settings.', tags: ['backup', 'export'] }, { id: 'set2', question: 'Can I import settings from another system?', answer: 'Import configuration: 1. Settings â†’ Backup tab 2. Click "Import" 3. Select JSON file 4. Review changes 5. Confirm import âš ï¸ Warning: Overwrites current settings! Backup first!', tags: ['import', 'restore', 'transfer'] }, { id: 'set3', question: 'How do I change my password?', answer: 'Change password: 1. Profile â†’ Security tab 2. Enter current password 3. Enter new password (min 6 chars) 4. Confirm new password 5. Click "Change Password" You'll be logged out. Sign in with new password.', tags: ['password', 'security'] }, { id: 'set4', question: 'Can I change the dashboard refresh rate?', answer: 'Adjust refresh rate: 1. Settings â†’ System tab 2. Find "Auto Refresh Interval" 3. Set 10-300 seconds 4. Toggle "Auto Refresh" on/off 5. Save settings Lower = more frequent but higher data usage.', tags: ['refresh', 'rate', 'dashboard'] }, { id: 'set5', question: 'How do I change the theme or language?', answer: 'Customize appearance: **Theme:** 1. Settings â†’ Preferences 2. Select theme: â€¢ Light (default) â€¢ Dark â€¢ Auto (system) **Language:** 1. Settings â†’ Preferences 2. Select language: â€¢ English â€¢ Swahili (Kiswahili) â€¢ More coming soon! Changes apply immediately.', tags: ['theme', 'language', 'appearance'] }, { id: 'set6', question: 'What data retention options are available?', answer: 'Data retention settings: 1. Settings â†’ System 2. Set retention period: â€¢ 7 days (minimal) â€¢ 30 days (default) â€¢ 90 days (recommended) â€¢ 365 days (maximum) **Note:** â€¢ Longer retention = more storage â€¢ Analytics limited by retention â€¢ Export data before it expires â€¢ Premium: Unlimited retention', tags: ['retention', 'storage', 'data'] } ], 'troubleshooting': [ { id: 'trb1', question: 'Node shows offline?', answer: 'Check: 1. Sensor powered on? 2. Cables connected? 3. Within 5m of cable end? 4. Check Health â†’ System Logs Still offline? Contact support.', tags: ['offline', 'fix'] }, { id: 'trb2', question: 'Water shows 0m?', answer: 'If hâ‚‚ â‰¥ hâ‚, water = 0m. Solution: 1. Settings â†’ Nodes 2. Check hâ‚ value 3. Update if incorrect 4. Save changes Formula: H = hâ‚ - hâ‚‚', tags: ['zero', 'water', 'height'] }, { id: 'trb3', question: 'Dashboard not updating?', answer: 'Fix dashboard issues: 1. Check auto-refresh (Settings â†’ System) 2. Hard refresh: Ctrl+Shift+R 3. Clear browser cache 4. Check internet connection 5. Verify Firebase status (Health page) 6. Try different browser If Health shows "Connected", data is flowing.', tags: ['dashboard', 'update', 'refresh'] }, { id: 'trb4', question: 'Sensor readings are erratic?', answer: 'Stabilize readings: **Common causes:** â€¢ Loose cable connections â€¢ Water turbulence â€¢ Sensor misalignment â€¢ Electrical interference â€¢ Temperature changes **Solutions:** 1. Secure all connections 2. Wait for water to settle 3. Check sensor position 4. Move away from electrical lines 5. Recalibrate sensor Contact support if persists.', tags: ['erratic', 'unstable', 'fluctuating'] }, { id: 'trb5', question: 'How do I reset a sensor node?', answer: 'Reset procedure: **Soft Reset:** 1. Settings â†’ Nodes 2. Click edit on node 3. Click "Reset Configuration" 4. Confirm reset **Hard Reset:** 1. Power off sensor 2. Wait 30 seconds 3. Power on sensor 4. Reconfigure in dashboard **Factory Reset:** â€¢ Contact support â€¢ Requires physical access â€¢ Clears all settings', tags: ['reset', 'restart', 'reboot'] }, { id: 'trb6', question: 'Battery draining too quickly?', answer: 'Extend battery life: **Check settings:** â€¢ Reduce check interval â€¢ Lower transmission power â€¢ Disable unnecessary features **Hardware:** â€¢ Clean solar panel â€¢ Check battery health â€¢ Verify charging circuit â€¢ Upgrade to larger battery **Expected life:** â€¢ Solar + battery: Indefinite â€¢ Battery only: 6-12 months â€¢ Depends on usage Monitor in Health â†’ Node Status.', tags: ['battery', 'power', 'drain'] } ], 'technical': [ { id: 'tech1', question: 'Water height formula?', answer: 'H = hâ‚ - hâ‚‚ Where: â€¢ H = Water height â€¢ hâ‚ = Cable length (fixed) â€¢ hâ‚‚ = Sensor reading (varies) Example: 50m - 45m = 5m water', tags: ['formula', 'calculation'] }, { id: 'tech2', question: 'How does LoRa communication work?', answer: 'LoRa Technology: **Sensor â†’ Gateway:** â€¢ Long Range (2-15km) â€¢ Low Power (<50mA) â€¢ 868/915 MHz frequency â€¢ Encrypted transmission **Gateway â†’ Cloud:** â€¢ Internet connection â€¢ Uploads to Firebase â€¢ Real-time sync **Cloud â†’ Dashboard:** â€¢ WebSocket connection â€¢ Instant updates â€¢ Data caching **Benefits:** â€¢ No cellular data needed â€¢ Works in remote areas â€¢ Very low power consumption', tags: ['lora', 'communication', 'wireless'] }, { id: 'tech3', question: 'What data is stored in Firebase?', answer: 'Database structure: **Real-time Data:** â€¢ Sensor readings (hâ‚‚) â€¢ Timestamps â€¢ Connection status â€¢ Battery levels **Configuration:** â€¢ Node settings (hâ‚, location) â€¢ System preferences â€¢ User profiles â€¢ Alert thresholds **Historical:** â€¢ Activity logs â€¢ System events â€¢ Error reports **Security:** â€¢ Encrypted at rest â€¢ Encrypted in transit â€¢ Role-based access', tags: ['firebase', 'database', 'storage'] }, { id: 'tech4', question: 'Can I integrate with other systems?', answer: 'Integration options: **REST API:** â€¢ GET /api/nodes - List nodes â€¢ GET /api/data/{nodeId} - Get readings â€¢ POST /api/alerts - Create alert â€¢ Authentication required **Webhooks:** â€¢ Real-time data push â€¢ Configure in Settings â€¢ JSON payload â€¢ Retry on failure **Exports:** â€¢ CSV/JSON download â€¢ Scheduled exports â€¢ Email delivery â€¢ FTP/SFTP upload API docs: docs.waleki.com/api', tags: ['api', 'integration', 'webhook'] }, { id: 'tech5', question: 'What is the system architecture?', answer: 'Waleki Architecture: **1. Sensor Layer:** â€¢ Ultrasonic sensors â€¢ LoRa transmitters â€¢ Solar/battery power **2. Network Layer:** â€¢ LoRa gateways â€¢ Internet connection â€¢ Edge processing **3. Cloud Layer:** â€¢ Firebase Realtime DB â€¢ Authentication â€¢ File storage **4. Application Layer:** â€¢ React web app â€¢ Real-time updates â€¢ Analytics engine **5. User Layer:** â€¢ Web browsers â€¢ Mobile devices â€¢ Admin panels', tags: ['architecture', 'system', 'design'] }, { id: 'tech6', question: 'How is data secured?', answer: 'Security measures: **Data Encryption:** â€¢ TLS 1.3 in transit â€¢ AES-256 at rest â€¢ End-to-end encryption **Authentication:** â€¢ Firebase Auth â€¢ Email verification â€¢ 2FA support â€¢ Session management **Authorization:** â€¢ Role-based access â€¢ Granular permissions â€¢ Audit logging **Network:** â€¢ Firewall protection â€¢ DDoS mitigation â€¢ Rate limiting â€¢ IP filtering **Compliance:** â€¢ GDPR ready â€¢ Data privacy â€¢ Regular audits', tags: ['security', 'encryption', 'privacy'] } ] }; const searchFAQs = () => { if (!searchQuery.trim()) return []; const query = searchQuery.toLowerCase(); const results = []; Object.entries(faqData).forEach(([category, faqs]) => { faqs.forEach(faq => { if (faq.question.toLowerCase().includes(query) || faq.answer.toLowerCase().includes(query) || faq.tags.some(tag => tag.includes(query))) { results.push({ ...faq, category }); } }); }); return results; }; const displayedFAQs = searchQuery.trim() ? searchFAQs() : faqData[activeTab] || []; const handleFeedback = (faqId, helpful) => { setFeedbackGiven({ ...feedbackGiven, [faqId]: helpful }); showToast(helpful ? 'Thanks for feedback!' : 'We'll improve this', 'success'); }; const copyToClipboard = (text) => { navigator.clipboard.writeText(text); showToast('Copied to clipboard!', 'success'); }; return (
{toast && setToast(null)} />}

Help & Support

Find answers and get expert support

setSearchQuery(e.target.value)} />
{Object.keys(faqData).map(tab => ( ))}
navigate('/settings')}>
Settings
navigate('/profile')}>
Profile
window.open('mailto:support@waleki.com')}>
Email

{searchQuery.trim() ? `Search: "${searchQuery}"` : activeTab.split('-').map(w => w[0].toUpperCase() + w.slice(1)).join(' ')}

{displayedFAQs.length} article{displayedFAQs.length !== 1 ? 's' : ''} found

{displayedFAQs.map(faq => (
{expandedFAQ === faq.id && (
{faq.answer}
Helpful?
)}
))}
); }; export default HelpPage;
